treasury_media.title: Improve Employee Engagement Through Recognition & Reward for Microsoft O365 and SP 2013
treasury_media.description:
ebook created for 'The European SharePoint Conference' Training Week eBooks & blogs.

Don't believe in gamification? Often people are weary about it, thinking it won't work for them or their organisation. "I don't care about winning" is often said. Or "I don't like games". 

This ebook will debunk misconceptions and biases by explaining the concept of gamification, and behavioural and psychological theory about motivation and engagement. Get insight on why improving employee engagement is important, and how gamification can leverage this by applying rewards and recognition. Learn about possibilities and see examples of reward & recognition features for Office 365, Yammer and SharePoint.

projects.title: Saxion University - User Adoption IBM Connections
projects.description:
For a dutch University we are working on an adoption approach for all employees. After a pilot fase earlier this year, we are now expanding to all employees (2000).

The adoption program is connected to the HR initiative 'Worx', a New Way of Working program (NWOW) that is to be launched.
Worx and Connections are introduced through an introductory film to sponsor the launch and to create a buzz and a general feeling what it is all about and to which goals the program is aimed.

To ensure IBM Connections is going to be fully adopted and integrated into work we are developing 8 usage scenarios. For each scenario we are crafting workshops (including train-the-trainer) for each scenario to be included in the Academy's courses. Also we are going to create scenario based films, which are to demonstrate the use cases for Connections scenarios, and not features and functionality.
To learn how to work with all the Connections featus there will also be small instruction videos (how-to's).

projects.title: User adoption for moving from Lotus Notes to Outlook
projects.description:
Geldservice Nederland (GSN) has implemented Outlook 2013 as their collaboration platform, replacing Lotus Notes 6.
In order to make the change go smooth, we held interviews on how employees were working with Notes, do an inventory of their current Notes applications and who owned them and checking e-mail dependencies on them.
We also formed a Champion group that has been testing standard Outlook 2013 functionality, and how it compares to what they are used to do in Notes. We made a recommendation on agreements and ways of working with Outlook, along with some preferences and settings, especially for group mailboxes and calendaring.
During one week all users were migrated to Outlook, and during that week we held presentations and workshops, as well as 'floorwalking' (support on the workfloor) at all the offices spread in the Netherlands.
